texts.label: text
texts.orig: I figured that the Puppy Linux and icanhazip.com fiasco was over, but I was wrong:
texts.text: I figured that the Puppy Linux and icanhazip.com fiasco was over, but I was wrong:

texts.label: text
texts.orig:
@majorhayden you're in Puppy Linux controversy again http://t.co/B21JPIx7Ob
#Heat
texts.text:
@majorhayden you're in Puppy Linux controversy again http://t.co/B21JPIx7Ob
#Heat

texts.label: text
texts.orig: After a quick visit to the forums,  I found the debate stirred up again . Various users were wondering if their internet connections were somehow compromised or if a remote American network was somehow spying on their internet traffic. Others wondered if some secretive software was added to the Puppy Linux distribution that was calling out to the site.
texts.text: After a quick visit to the forums,  I found the debate stirred up again . Various users were wondering if their internet connections were somehow compromised or if a remote American network was somehow spying on their internet traffic. Others wondered if some secretive software was added to the Puppy Linux distribution that was calling out to the site.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Fortunately, quite a few users on the forum showed up  to explain  that Puppy Linux has a built-in feature to figure out a user's external IP address to help them get started with their system after it boots.  Another user  was kind enough to  dig up the Lifehacker post  about icanhazip from 2011.
texts.text: Fortunately, quite a few users on the forum showed up  to explain  that Puppy Linux has a built-in feature to figure out a user's external IP address to help them get started with their system after it boots.  Another user  was kind enough to  dig up the Lifehacker post  about icanhazip from 2011.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Many users on the forum were still dissatisfied. Many of them turned their questions to maintainers of the distribution (which is where those questions should go), but many others felt that icanhazip was the source of the problem. Some of them felt so strongly that they called my hosting provider via telephone to curse at them. Here's a snippet of an email I received from my colocation provider:
texts.text: Many users on the forum were still dissatisfied. Many of them turned their questions to maintainers of the distribution (which is where those questions should go), but many others felt that icanhazip was the source of the problem. Some of them felt so strongly that they called my hosting provider via telephone to curse at them. Here's a snippet of an email I received from my colocation provider:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: I had an interesting call from someone today said that 216.69.252.101 was showing up on his computer. Sounded kind of [omitted] and called me a    ***…
texts.text: I had an interesting call from someone today said that 216.69.252.101 was showing up on his computer. Sounded kind of [omitted] and called me a    ***…

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I'm a huge supporter of everything Linux, including Puppy Linux. I don't hold a grudge against the project for what a minority of their users do.
texts.text: I'm a huge supporter of everything Linux, including Puppy Linux. I don't hold a grudge against the project for what a minority of their users do.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I don't collect data when users visit icanhazip.com other than standard Apache logs. No cookies are used.
texts.text: I don't collect data when users visit icanhazip.com other than standard Apache logs. No cookies are used.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I run these applications on my own time, with my own money, and my own resources.
texts.text: I run these applications on my own time, with my own money, and my own resources.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Before I forget, thanks to all of the folks who came forward in the forums to explain what was actually happening and defend the work I've done. I'm tremendously flattered to receive that kind of support.
texts.text: Before I forget, thanks to all of the folks who came forward in the forums to explain what was actually happening and defend the work I've done. I'm tremendously flattered to receive that kind of support.
